title_en: Thousands of Calgary workers voted to strike
summary_en:
Thousands of Calgary workers voted to go on strike.
CUPE Local 38 has been negotiating since November last year, representing about 5,000 technical and administrative staff.
There are two serious issues on the agenda: wages and the "work from home" policy.
The union is calling for a 10.5% wage increase over three years.
The city authorities have proposed an 8% salary increase over three years, but the union demands that the inflation rate be taken into account.
Almost 90% of the organization's members voted for the strike, but have not yet taken to the pickets.
The union will start with the "From Work to Power" campaign before the start of the real strike.

summary_en:
Prison staff in Antwerp province have launched a 48-hour strike following protests in other regions of Belgium.
The strikes are caused by long-standing problems such as prison overcrowding and staff shortages.
Protests will take place in prisons in various cities, including Mechelen, Turnhout, Merksplace and Antwerp.
The prison administration claims to be trying to speed up recruitment to address staff shortages.
The number of prisoners sleeping on makeshift mattresses on the floor has decreased significantly.
The Belgian penitentiary system is designed for 10,000 prisoners, but contains 12,000 people.
Prison overcrowding is a concern for trade unions, especially as summer approaches and temperatures rise.

title_en: The broadcasting of FRANCE 24 TV channel was interrupted due to a strike by employees against the merger of state-owned media
summary_en:
The broadcasting of FRANCE 24 TV channel and its digital platforms has been interrupted due to a strike by employees against the merger of state-owned media.
Employees of France Medias Monde, France T√©l√©visions and Radio France are on strike against the proposed merger of the French public broadcasting sector.
Culture Minister Rashida Dati advocates a transitional stage with the creation of a joint public broadcasting holding company.
The new media group will unite France T√©l√©visions, Radio France, the National Audiovisual Institute and France Medias Monde.
The country faces special geopolitical challenges due to its international orientation.
Deputies of the National Assembly plan to discuss the reform in the first reading on Thursday, but the debate may be postponed until June 24.
Unions have issued strike notices expressing concerns about a lack of resources and jobs.

title_en: Another workers' strike in the Mangystau region has been going on for the tenth day
summary_en:
In the Mangystau region, workers of the Zhalgiztobemunai company have been on strike for the tenth day.
The workers claim that the management violates their labor rights.
The workers demand to investigate the activities of Zhalgiztobemnaya and continue the strike until their demands are met.
The management of Zhalgiztobemnaya suspended 22 workers for not completing training and testing their knowledge in the field of industrial safety.
The workers have received certificates of completion of training and demand to be allowed to work, regardless of the place where they received the certificates.
Strikes by workers in the Mangystau region occur regularly, including a major protest in December 2023.

title_en: Strikes: settlement of a tariff dispute on local public transport in North Rhine-Westphalia
summary_en:
Improvement of working conditions for approximately 30,000 employees of municipal transport enterprises.
Most of the members of the Verdi trade union supported the collective decision proposed by the arbitration.
The agreement provides for a four-day delay for a wide range of workers until the end of 2026.
Starting this year, all employees will have two additional days off, and in 2025 and 2026, another day off for most employees.
The main points of the agreement provide for a phased increase in the annual surcharge to 100% and an increase in the calculation base for surcharges over time.
Verdi NRW agreed to arbitration proceedings, which led to the cessation of strikes in public transport.

title_en: Morrisons workers strike at two warehouses amid pension scandal
summary_en:
About 1,000 Morrisons warehouse workers will go on strike over the company's reduced contributions to their pensions.
Employees lose an average of 500 pounds a year due to the company's plan to reduce costs by replenishing the pension fund.
The Unite union claims that Morrisons is also waiving superannuation and increasing the speed of processing goods in warehouses.
The general secretary of Unite accuses Morrisons of "planning to defraud workers" and making the situation of union members worse by the month.
Until March, employees contributed 3% of their salary to the pension fund, while Morrisons deducted 5%.
Morrisons says the loss of pension contributions will be offset by the proposed salary increase.
The strikes at Morrisons warehouses followed actions at centers run by Amazon and Asda stores over wages and working conditions.

title_en: Chemnitz: strike at the city railway: the court must secure school transport
summary_en:
The Chemnitz Labour Court is dealing with a power struggle between the city railway and the GDL trade union.
The railway company wants to seek an injunction to prevent further school transport strikes.
About 1,800 children and teenagers use the city railway lines daily to travel to and from school.
The strikes affected both children and teenagers due to the demands of the GDL train drivers' union for the introduction of a 35-hour working week on urban railways.
The municipal enterprise has repeatedly staged strikes because of this requirement.

title_en: The Court of Appeal upheld the right of TTC employees to strike in connection with possible employment claims
summary_en:
The Ontario Supreme Court upheld the right of TTC workers to strike.
The Court of Appeal rejected the Government's appeal against the lower court's decision.
The court's decision protects the right to strike, which cannot be taken away at the whim of the Government.
In 2011, the Ontario government passed a law prohibiting TTC unionized workers from striking.
The judge of the Higher Court ruled that the law violated the rights of employees to collective bargaining.
The decision was made separately, and two of the three judges of the Court of Appeal sided with the union.
AUT Local 113 represents about 12,000 operators and other support staff at the TTC.
The union said they remain at the negotiating table, hoping to make progress on key issues.
The collective agreement of the trade union expired on March 31, 2024.
In April, 12,000 workers voted to go on strike.

title_en: "We are still far apart": Union representing TTC workers announces strike date
summary_en:
The TTC workers union announced a strike on June 7 after the Ontario Supreme Court upheld the right to strike.
Negotiations are ongoing, but the parties are still far from each other on issues of employment, wages and benefits.
The union's executive council carefully considered the decision and set a strike date for June 7, 2024.
The collective agreement of the trade union expired on March 31, 2024.
In April, 12,000 workers voted overwhelmingly to go on strike.
The TTC advisor warned of possible delays or cancellations of flights for riders due to the strike.

title_en: Deliveroo drivers demonstrate outside the company's general meeting of shareholders
summary_en:
Deliveroo drivers hold a demonstration and a convoy to protest against "soul-destroying" working conditions.
The protesters criticize the authorities for low wages and job security.
Drivers are facing increasing financial difficulties due to low pay and unclear changing fares.
Representatives of the trade union and the Independent Workers Union of Great Britain addressed the CEO and the board of directors.
Deliveroo has entered into a partnership with the GMB trade union and increased the guaranteed minimum wage for drivers.
Drivers complain about the steady decline in real wages and the stress associated with paying bills.
Deliveroo offers flexible working and attractive earning and protection opportunities, but many drivers are unhappy with their jobs.
